understanding behavior as if we are constantly exchanging messages defining the nature of relationships of which we are a part ; shifting focus of attention from intent to the effects of behavior as communication ; observer-imposed punctuation ; emphasizing the vital role of the therapist 's preconceptions in bringing forth socially constructed reality ; investing the ramifications of self-fulfilling prophecy ; and articulating and fully embracing the `` as if '' nature of behavior.a term that is used often in the theory of the interactional view is enabler . his confirmation was approved <decimal> on october <days> , <year> and he received his commission on october <days> , <year> . he joined the department of customs and excise in manchester the same year and transferred to london in <year> . in <year> ( several publications cite <year> ) , he immigrated to mandatory palestine with his family to escape soviet terror by the newly-elected joseph stalin and settled in jerusalem . doi:<decimal>/<decimal> . `` the wish not to see one 's country overrun by groups one regards as alien need not be based on feelings of superiority or 'racism . advanced the hypothesis that during embryonic life and immediately after birth , cells gradually acquire the ability to distinguish between their own tissue substances on the one hand and unwanted cells and foreign material on the other.with billingham , he published a seminal paper in <year> on grafting technique . p. <decimal> <integer> . in his honour , luxembourg 's main cricket ground ,
